titleStmt.title: The Most vile and lamentable confession of Hugh Peters of all his bloody advices given to the late Oliver Cromwel, touching all the horrid murders committed upon those martyrs whose names are all herein specified, immediately after his apprehension neer Horsly-down, Sept.4. Together with a conference between him and Sir Henry Martin, now in the Tower of London. Sing hey homy honey, my heart shall never rue, twenty four traytors now for a penny, and into the bargain Hugh.
titleStmt.author: Peters, Hugh, 1598-1660,
Marten, Henry, 1602-1680,

publicationStmt.publisher: for John Andrews at the white-Lyon near Pie-Corner,

notesStmt.note: Not in fact by Hugh Peters. A satire.
The first leaf contains a portrait of Henry Marten on the recto and a portrait of Hugh Peters on the verso. The final leaf contains a woodcut on the verso.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
